title: How to Varnish Bread

steps.headline: Leave the bread, rolls or other bread item out to dry.
steps.description: Place in a basket or other open container and leave in a dry area for one to two weeks. The bread is ready for varnishing when it has dried rock hard.

steps.headline: Set down newspaper or other covering on the workspace.
steps.description: This will prevent varnish from staining the surface and makes it easy to collect up any crumbs.

steps.headline: Paint or spray paint the bread or rolls.
steps.description: Use a suitably sized paintbrush (if painting) or use direct from the spray can. Apply the first coat to the bread. Allow to dry for at least 6 hours, or longer if required by the instructions accompanying the varnish.

steps.headline: Apply one to two more coats.
steps.description: Allow to dry for at least 6 hours (or more) between each varnish.

steps.headline: Done.
steps.description: You can decorate using ribbons, straw, dried flowers etc. The bread looks best placed in rustic items, such as basket ware or old containers. Place on display.
